item.title: Two eight-year-old girls with nowhere to go highlight Kununurra's social issues
item.description: With young people in Kununurra making news for the wrong reasons over the last month, a police patrol shows the stark reality for children on the streets.

item.title: PR campaign to relocate Melbourne sculpture to Mildura 'profoundly silly' says artist
item.description: The artist whose sculpture headlines a regional Victorian tourism campaign says it's a "beat up to get publicity".

item.title: Jeffrey Epstein mentioned Donald Trump in several newly released emails. This is what he said
item.description: Donald Trump's relationship with Jeffrey Epstein is pushed back into the spotlight after he was named in several years-old emails unearthed by a congressional committee investigation.

item.title: 'Nothing was being done': Inpex workers raise fears over toxic chemical emissions and oil spills
item.description: In the wake of a federal government investigation, a worker at major oil and gas company Inpex has spoken out, raising fears of exposure to dangerous air pollutants and claims of a toxic workplace where staff concerns are brushed aside.

item.title: More players involved in Shield, First Guardian collapses face ASIC legal action
item.description: Corporate watchdog ASIC is suing several players involved in the collapses of Shield and/or First Guardian, which led to Australians losing more than $1 billion of their retirement savings.

item.title: Country SA heavy metal band KNAW travels 800km for 40-minute gig
item.description: Heavy metal band KNAW dream of playing festivals one day. The problem is they are the only band of their kind around for hundreds of kilometres.

item.title: Australia's unemployment rate slips to 4.3 per cent
item.description: The unemployment rate fell to 4.3 per cent in October, down from 4.5 per cent in September, as the number of people in employment increased by 42,200.

item.title: Renowned lawyer returns to Wittenoom asbestos case that changed his life
item.description: Forty years ago, the Wittenoom asbestos disaster changed Peter Gordon's life. Now he has come back to finish what he started.

item.title: Trump signs bill to end longest government shutdown in US history
item.description: President Donald Trump has signed a bill ending the longest government shutdown in US history.

item.title: Contact tracing underway in Queensland as health authorities brace for further measles cases
item.description: Health authorities expect to see more confirmed cases of measles in the next 48 hours as contact tracing into a Brisbane outbreak begins.

item.title: Hundreds of Qantas jobs to come to new innovation centre in Adelaide
item.description: The South Australian government has entered into an agreement with Qantas for a Product Innovation Centre that is expected to create more than 420 technology jobs by the end of 2028.

item.title: Documentary follows William Corlett's week-long 500km Blue Mountains run
item.description: A documentary following a young man's epic 500-kilometre run over seven days is nominated for awards at six international film festivals.

item.title: Australia's spring weather swings from hot to cold and back again in battle of the seasons
item.description: From heat, back to snow, fire danger and storm warnings — spring weather has given the country some serious whiplash. What's behind it?

item.title: Liberal Party formally abandons net zero by 2050 climate target
item.description: The decision brings the party closer to the Nationals, which ditched its support for the target earlier this month amid internal turmoil over the Coalition's policy.

item.title: Victoria will introduce adult jail sentences for children, but experts warn it won't fix youth crime
item.description: The Allan government will mirror Queensland with harsher jail sentences for children, but experts say the new legislation will not reduce youth crime.

item.title: Eliza West fell out of favour with Melbourne. Now she's leading Hawthorn in finals
item.description: Eliza West is leading the Hawks on a finals charge in the AFLW, but it comes after a 'disheartening' call at the Demons.

item.title: Traditional owner slams Andrew Forrest legal rehash over sacred Ashburton River serpent
item.description: An Aboriginal elder has slammed Andrew Forrest as a state tribunal into plans to alter a WA river hears critical evidence.

item.title: AC/DC concert shakes Melbourne all night long with low-level seismology recordings
item.description: Rock royalty AC/DC power up the earthshaking riffs at the MCG, rattling Melbourne with low-level seismic recordings.

item.title: How Fully Sikh author Sukhjit Kaur Khalsa's life was shaped by slam poetry
item.description: This year, Sukhjit Kaur Khalsa earned an Order of Australia medal and published her first book, Fully Sikh, all while running an indie theatre in Perth.

item.title: Vote on releasing Jeffrey Epstein files set to go ahead as US government shutdown ends
item.description: As the longest government shutdown in US history winds up, a fresh bout of political infighting is brewing over the Jeffrey Epstein files.

item.title: Mezzo-soprano Joyce DiDonato, advocate for opera for all, on her first Australian tour
item.description: Joyce DiDonato is one of opera's most in-demand mezzo-sopranos. She shares her passion for inclusivity and advocacy ahead of her first Australian tour.

item.title: What we know about the ties between Donald Trump and Jeffrey Epstein
item.description: Years-old emails from Jeffrey Epstein mentioning Donald Trump have been released, raising new questions about the extent of their relationship. Here's what we know about the ties between them.

item.title: Townsville mayoral candidate recruits lost tourist in exchange for lift to cruise ship
item.description: Joanne Keune maintains the tourist says it was the best thing that happened to him in Townsville.

item.title: Shay Mitchell's new skincare brand for children sparks controversy
item.description: A new skincare line for children by actress-turned-entrepreneur Shay Mitchell creates an online uproar, with many questioning the need for the products.

item.title: Bribie Island officially reconnected as workers close breakthrough
item.description: Operators pushing tonnes of sand across a breakthrough at Bribie Island have officially closed the gap.

item.title: Shire of Augusta-Margaret River doubles fines and looks at night restrictions as part of illegal camping crackdown
item.description: A WA council has doubled fines for illegal camping and will look at locking people out of visitor hotspots at night, as it struggles to stop people staying in vans and tents at popular tourist spots.

item.title: Ley's net zero decision may bring her extra time as leader, but at what cost?
item.description: Ley's decision may have brought her extra time as leader. The question will be at what cost.

item.title: Unmasking the men who attended a Neo-Nazi protest outside NSW parliament
item.description: Around 60 men attended a protest at NSW parliament organised by the Neo-Nazi group National Socialist Network on Saturday. Without masks, it gave the ABC the opportunity to identify some of them.

item.title: Push to return 130GL of water to Murray-Darling Basin sparks backlash
item.description: More water rights in the Murray-Darling Basin will be purchased from farmers and irrigators in a renewed push by the federal government to return 450 gigalitres of water to the environment.

item.title: Jane Goodall farewelled in Washington, DC, Leonardo DiCaprio among mourners
item.description: The groundbreaking primatologist, who died in October, has been farewelled at a service in Washington, DC.

item.title: Thursday Finance with David Chau
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Mark Wood suffers hamstring injury in England's pre-Ashes tour match
item.description: One of England's great bowling hopes for the summer cops a blow, as Mark Wood fails to finish the first day of a tour match.

item.title: Tasmanian salmon selectively bred to withstand warmer waters and bacterial disease
item.description: A salmon mass mortality event caused by a bacterial outbreak has given scientists "a lot of genetic knowledge" to put to use in a selective breeding program.

item.title: The Liberal Party officially abandons its net zero by 2050 target
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Yipirinya School's future in doubt as enrolments plummet and debts mount
item.description: The future of an independent Indigenous school in Alice Springs is under a cloud after just 50 students turned up to class on Thursday, down from a peak enrolment of 360 in December last year.

item.title: Gaming addiction treatment pioneer, botanist honoured at WA Australian of the Year awards
item.description: The psychiatrist who pioneered the country's first gaming disorder clinic at a public hospital has been named the 2026 Australian of the Year for WA.

item.title: Israeli settlers in West Bank torch mosque and scrawl hateful messages
item.description: Settler violence against Palestinian communities in the West Bank has been on the rise in recent years.

item.title: Have you spotted a 'smiley' graffiti around Tasmania? This is who spray-paints most of them
item.description: Ever noticed the hundreds of smiley faces graffitied on buildings, the back of road signs, guardrails and bridges around Tasmania? The artist says the world needs more joy.

item.title: Victoria's treaty is here. What does it mean? And is one coming to my state?
item.description: Hundreds of treaties exist between First Nations people and governments around the world. One state in Australia just became one of them.

item.title: Liberal plan to put public money into coal and gas may do little to help prices or emissions
item.description: Energy experts have cast doubt over the Liberal Party's central claim that it can bring down power prices by backing coal and gas, while questioning how the party plans to actually reduce emissions.

item.title: Trump has floated a 50-year mortgage to help first-time buyers. Could it work?
item.description: The average first-time home buyer in the US is older than ever, but a new proposal could leave them paying off a mortgage until old age.

item.title: Yield could drop but berry grower confident industry will adapt to dimethoate use changes
item.description: New rules around a popular insecticide could lead to lower blueberry production, but growers are confident the industry will adapt.

item.title: Allan government crime crackdown continues with focus on retail and hospitality assaults
item.description: New offences for people assaulting or threatening service workers are expected to be introduced in time for the Christmas shopping rush.

item.title: Supercell risk for eastern Australia as peak severe weather season arrives
item.description: Peak severe weather season is arriving, and an influx of tropical moisture will fuel thunderstorms in all Australian states and territories between Friday and Sunday.

item.title: Despondent Liberal moderates fear electoral oblivion in metropolitan seats after net zero scrapped
item.description: While many Liberals who wanted to keep net zero say they are happy with the position the party has taken, some despondent moderates fear electoral oblivion in metropolitan seats.

item.title: Liberals deliver slap in the face to voters by dumping net zero
item.description: The Liberal conservatives' success in forcing their party to dump its commitment to the net zero emissions reduction target has been a triumph of ideology over pragmatism.

item.title: 'Swarm' of fossil fuel lobbyists coming to COP31, former SA premier warns
item.description: Former South Australian premier Mike Rann has sharply criticised the gas industry and warned that "battalions" of fossil fuel lobbyists will be descending on next year's UN climate summit to influence negotiations.

item.title: Queensland drug testing ban halted research exposing dangers of illegal steroids
item.description: A researcher who found "dangerous" toxic metals in illegal anabolic steroids is in talks the health department officials to continue his work despite Queensland's drug checking ban.

item.title: Possible severe storms predicted for Queensland's south-east and Darling Downs
item.description: After a few days of mostly clear weather across Queensland, storms are likely to return to most parts of the state today.

item.title: Federal politics: Malcolm Turnbull says Liberals have 'memory of goldfish and diet of piranhas' on net zero — as it happened
item.description: Former prime minister Malcolm Turnbull says the Liberals have the "memory of goldfish and diet of piranhas" after dumping net zero by 2050.

item.title: Snap closure of schools in Canberra and Brisbane after asbestos found in recalled coloured sand
item.description: Schools in Canberra and Brisbane are closed today due to asbestos in decorative coloured sand.

item.title: Photographer David Finlay spends week documenting erupting Kilauea volcano
item.description: David Finlay has captured images of bioluminescence, fireflies, ghost mushrooms, meteors and the aurora australis, but seeing one of the world's most active volcanoes spraying lava 450 metres in the air "takes the cake".

item.title: Alex de Minaur keeps ATP Finals campaign alive by beating Taylor Fritz in must-win clash
item.description: Alex de Minaur responds to a crushing loss earlier in the week by toppling America's Taylor Fritz to remain in contention at the ATP Finals in Turin, although he needs a helping hand from a rival.

item.title: Miloš Degenek savours Socceroos second coming, sets example for others
item.description: Socceroos defender Miloš Degenek wasn't sure if he'd ever make it back to the national side, now he's a key cog in the team, and entertaining the thought of a World Cup win.

item.title: ASX drops sharply after Wall Street tumbles, TPG Telecom plummets — as it happened
item.description: The ASX falls steeply in response to a sharp drop on Wall Street overnight, which was led by a big decline in tech stocks. TPG Telecom plunged 32 per cent after the stock traded without rights to the next dividend payment.

item.title: APY Art Centre Collective sues The Australian's publisher for defamation seeking $4.4m payout
item.description: The truth behind claims of "white hands on black art" will be tested in the SA Supreme Court as one of the country's best-known Aboriginal art groups sues Rupert Murdoch's national masthead for defamation.

item.title: Hayley Silver-Holmes takes three wickets in an over and Lizelle Lee stars as Hurricanes dominate Sixers
item.description: Hayley Silver-Holmes shows her class after recovering from a nightmare run with injuries before her opening teammates set a record with the bat to deliver the Hobart Hurricanes a win over the Sydney Sixers.

item.title: Matildas star Kyra Cooney-Cross nominated for 'Marta' award for goal of the season
item.description: Kyra Cooney-Cross is nominated for the goal of the year award, but has stiff competition from the player the award is named after.

item.title: Australian artist Lynette Wallworth travels to the Amazon to explore psychedelics and death
item.description: Australian filmmaker Lynette Wallworth accompanies two palliative care doctors researching psilocybin use deep into the Amazon jungle to see if it can change the end-of-life experience for terminal patients.

item.title: Concussion protocols should be strengthened following Eliesa Katoa incident, neuroscientist says
item.description: A leading concussion expert calls for sporting bodies to strengthen their protocols on players who are concussed before and during matches.

item.title: Towns in the Kimberley are struggling to combat youth crime but Fitzroy Crossing has found a way
item.description: As Kununurra battles with a surge in youth crime, residents in Fitzroy Crossing are celebrating their success in reducing rates through a community-led initiative.

item.title: Perth family still don't know if father's death was linked to Optus Triple Zero outage
item.description: The family of a Perth man whose death was tied to the Optus Triple Zero outage claims authorities left them in the dark for weeks and are still unsure how his death was connected to the telco failure.

item.title: England captain Ben Stokes appears embarrassed by six-wicket haul in Ashes warm-up
item.description: Ben Stokes appears embarrassed with almost every single one of his six wickets as England's bowling attack leaves much to be desired in their only tour match before the Ashes opener in Perth.

item.title: Blue Origin launches huge rocket carrying twin NASA spacecraft to Mars
item.description: Blue Origin has successfully launched the 98-metre New Glenn rocket with a pair of NASA spacecraft destined for Mars.

item.title: Hyperlapse footage showing lights from aurora australis over Connewarre in Victoria.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Aurora australis viewed from Mt Stromlo Observatory in Canberra
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: When the southern lights are seen further north
item.description: The strength of the latest geomagnetic storms has seen the aurora australis light up skies across a larger part of the country than usual.

item.title: Two children were struck by cars near Rouse Hill Public School before death of Islah Metcalfe
item.description: Parents of children at a Sydney school where a five-year-old girl was fatally struck are demanding action to improve road safety after it emerged two more children were hit by cars nearby before the girl's death.

item.title: Cristiano Ronaldo receives first red card of international career after elbow to Irishman
item.description: Cristiano Ronaldo is mocked by Irish fans after being sent off for the first time in his international career following a vicious swinging elbow at his opponent in a World Cup qualifier.

item.title: Blue Origin launches New Glenn rocket on NASA mission
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: WA grazier accepts wild donkey cull order but refuses to pull the trigger himself
item.description: A WA pastoralist says he will not stand in the way of the bullets aimed at the donkeys on his remote property, but he will not kill the animals he says have had a positive environmental impact.

item.title: What we know about the coloured sand recalled from Officeworks, Woolworths over traces of asbestos
item.description: Fifteen public schools in Canberra are closed today, and several others are partially closed, due to potential asbestos contamination in coloured sand sold at dozens of stores across Australia. Here is what we know.

item.title: Benjamin Netanyahu insists he won't seek pardon on corruption case after Donald Trump's letter
item.description: The Israeli PM says he will not push for a pardon or concede guilt in his long-running corruption trial, less than a day after thanking Donald Trump for urging Israel's president to clear his record.

item.title: Wallabies announces team to face Ireland in spring tour Test match, James O'Connor returns at fly-half
item.description: The Wallabies have recalled several big-name players for their penultimate Test of 2025, as coach Joe Schmidt returns to his old Irish stamping ground.

item.title: Medical waste destined for landfill diverted to wildlife charities in Victoria
item.description: A Victorian medical charity helps divert 15,000 tonnes of medical waste from landfill while giving wildlife carers the resources to nurse injured animals back to health.

item.title: Cynthia Erivo praised for protecting co-star Ariana Grande from invader at Wicked event
item.description: Video shared across social media shows a man jumping over a crowd-control barrier, running towards Grande and putting his arms around the singer.

item.title: When is the 2025 AFL draft? Here's your guide to bidding, trades and the official pick order
item.description: Another AFL draft has arrived, offering dozens of teenage footballers the chance to realise their dreams. Here is everything you need to know.

item.title: Ex-Spanish football boss who kissed World Cup player gets egged during book launch
item.description: The former president of Spain's national football federation, who made headlines after his behaviour following the final of the 2023 FIFA Women's World Cup, has had eggs thrown at him during the launch of his book.

item.title: Eliesa Katoa to be moved to Melbourne hospital as brain surgery recovery continues
item.description: NRL star Eliesa Katoa faces more time in hospital when he returns to Melbourne as he recovers from a brain bleed after playing for Tonga.

item.title: The minimal-effort herbs and edible plants that produce for years
item.description: Fresh herbs can be expensive at the supermarket, but many perennial varieties are cheap and easy to grow at home.

item.title: Dementia now the leading cause of death nationwide, overtaking heart disease, new ABS data shows
item.description: New data on causes of death reveals more than 17,500 people died of dementia in 2024 nationwide, according to the Australian Bureau of Statistics.

item.title: Illegal tobacco retailer hit with $1.5 million fine following record seizure in Queensland
item.description: The charges stemmed from a statewide crackdown on the illegal tobacco trade.

item.title: Bondi Sands the latest brand to recall sunscreens over potential SPF concerns
item.description: A major Australian sunscreen brand, Bondi Sands is the latest to announce recalls over potential SPF concerns, and the first to remove products from shelves that have not been identified as using the same problematic base formulation.

item.title: Seal escapes orca hunt by jumping onto photographer's boat
item.description: A wildlife photographer has captured the dramatic moment a seal eluded a pod of killer whales by scrambling onto the stern of her boat.

item.title: Seal seeks refuge on photographer's boat while fleeing orcas
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Man who drove into floodwater in NSW central west sentenced over boy's death
item.description: A man has been sentenced to a one year intensive corrections order, to be served in the community, after attempting to drive through floodwater in the NSW central west, resulting in the death of a five-year-old.

item.title: NSW government workers' comp changes defeated as premier declares fight is 'over'
item.description: The Minns government has been unable to break an impasse after six months of trying to pass the legislation.

item.title: England hits out in Perth Ashes warm-up match as Joe Root misses out
item.description: England star Joe Root is yet to score a Test century in Australia and was out for one run despite the team's strong platform in the warm-up match.

item.title: Vanuatu flags expulsion of foreign advisers from government buildings as Nakamal Agreement hangs in balance
item.description: The move will affect Australia and New Zealand's multiple police and defence personnel working in Vanuatu, and could set back the signing of the Nakamal Agreement.

item.title: Major feed mill in the Northern Territory getting back on track after fire
item.description: A feed mill in the Northern Territory is getting back on track after a major fire destroyed more than $3 million of hay.

item.title: Friday finance with David Chau
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Ratepayers to foot $2m bill to remove contaminated FOGO waste from South West facility
item.description: The City of Bunbury and Shire of Harvey agree to contribute up to $1 million each to remove contaminated organic waste that caused the closure of a regional three-bin waste system.

item.title: What is a supercell storm and why are they so destructive?
item.description: Australia is in its peak severe weather system and there are warnings that supercell storms could hit the east coast this weekend. So what exactly is a supercell?

item.title: Australia earns Billie Jean King Cup victory over Portugal, Maya Joint and Kim Birrell claim wins
item.description: Australia got their Billie Jean King Cup play-off campaign to a successful start, with two straight sets singles victories over Portugal.

item.title: Tasmania's Lake St Clair confirmed as Australia's deepest with 3D mapping technology
item.description: Recent CSIRO research definitively places Tasmania's Lake St Clair at 163 metres deep, nearly twice the depth of Bass Strait.

item.title: Meg Lanning hits 90* in 100th WBBL game as Stars down Scorchers by 16 runs, Strikers defeat Renegades
item.description: Former Australia captain Meg Lanning and South Africa batter Laura Wolvaardt sparkle in wins for the Melbourne Stars and Adelaide Strikers.

item.title: Free concert in Melbourne CBD cancelled after overcrowding and safety concerns
item.description: A free concert scheduled in Melbourne's Fed Square was cancelled at the last minute on Friday night, with organisers citing overcrowding.

item.title: More than 11,000 customers lose power as storms with spectacular lightning hit south-east Queensland
item.description: An intense storm cell with dramatic lightning moves over the Brisbane area, delaying Friday evening commuters with heavy rain, strong winds and large hail.

item.title: Corey Rocchiccioli stars as WA beats Queensland in one-wicket Sheffield Shield thriller
item.description: Spinner Corey Rocchiccioli and No. 11 Cameron Gannon combine for a 23-run final wicket stand to deliver Western Australia a last-gasp Sheffield Shield victory over Queensland.

item.title: Court finds 'pollutant' BHP liable over deadly Brazilian dam collapse
item.description: A British court has ruled mining giant BHP liable for a deadly dam collapse in Brazil a decade ago, which sparked one of the world's largest environmental disasters on record.

item.title: Trump's BBC and Epstein sagas dominate attention as international relations are rewritten
item.description: As what's happening in Trump's America dominates our attention there is a lot going on, mostly involving everyone else around the world refashioning their politics in an environment that has never seemed more uncertain.

item.title: The Paris conundrum at the heart of the Coalition's net zero backflip
item.description: Liberal shadow cabinet members landed on a plan that has left many inside and outside the party bewildered and confused.

item.title: Jeffrey Epstein emails show he kept tabs on Donald Trump for years
item.description: A trove of Jeffrey Epstein emails released this week reveals his preoccupation with US President Donald Trump in the years before Epstein's death.

item.title: Andrew Forrest is betting on renewable energy in Queensland's coal heartland
item.description: At a wind farm in central Queensland, the billionaire backer and the local boilermaker offer a glimpse into how the energy transition is reshaping regional communities.

item.title: Equestrian Australia received complaint about Olympian weeks before investigating
item.description: Australia's peak body for equestrian sports received a controversial video of Olympic rider Heath Ryan appearing to whip a horse weeks before an investigation was commenced.

item.title: Financial markets meltdown fears spread as US interest rate cut hopes fade
item.description: Markets are heading south over fears about the US economy and interest rates not falling. Analysts fear mortgage holders and superannuates are in the firing line.

item.title: Nationals leader happy to let Liberals 'dream' of net zero in Coalition deal on climate
item.description: The Nationals will be meeting with the Liberals on Sunday to sign off on a climate policy.

item.title: Health star ratings likely to become mandatory as food industry misses 70pc target
item.description: Health ministers will meet next year and decide whether or not to make the system mandatory for all packaged food, something public health experts say is overdue.

item.title: After tireless advocacy and a dark history, Australia has a treaty with its First Peoples
item.description: Aunty Thelma lived through the mission era, stolen children and forced assimilation. As she witnessed the signing of the country's first treaty, her thoughts were on those who came before.

item.title: As the social media ban sets in, how do you decide what TV to let your kids watch?
item.description: We have navigated this new path of "what to watch/what to censor/what to allow" with stumbling footsteps. I'd love to tell you we have been perfectly consistent. We have not.

item.title: Jannik Sinner wary of Alex de Minaur ahead of ATP Finals semis
item.description: Reigning champion Jannik Sinner says he will need to produce his best tennis to get past Alex de Minaur in the semis at the season-ending ATP Finals.

item.title: Football coach Zia Younan found quietly playing in Melbourne suburbs despite FIFA ban for match-fixing
item.description: A corrupt coach who was banned for life by the world football governing body for match-fixing has been quietly playing for clubs in suburban Melbourne.

item.title: Ewens Ponds set to reopen for public snorkelling after environmental concerns prompted closure
item.description: A date is set for snorkellers to return Ewens Ponds on South Australia's Limestone Coast, after low water flows caused its closure to the public.

item.title: England great James Anderson tips Australian Ashes win
item.description: Legendary England fast bowler James Anderson says Australia is favourite to win the men's Ashes series on home soil, but feels the hosts will field their "weakest" team in 15 years.

item.title: Dolly Parton heads to Australian desert in unique exhibit celebrating rising art star Kaylene Whiskey
item.description: Dolly Parton has never stepped foot on the dry red dirt of Indulkana in remote South Australia, but she is a frequent visitor in the art of Kaylene Whisky, which celebrates sisterhood and strong women.

item.title: Guy Sebastian's new album looks back on remarkable career
item.description: Guy Sebastian looks back on the good fortune he has enjoyed in his music career, with the release of his 10th studio album, 100 Times Around the Sun.

item.title: Donald Trump seeks probe of Epstein ties to JP Morgan, Bill Clinton and other prominent Democrats
item.description: The request comes two days after thousands of documents were released that raised new questions about Mr Trump's relationship with Epstein.

item.title: Bureau of Meteorology predicting another round of severe storms for south-east Queensland this weekend
item.description: Large hail, damaging winds and heavy rainfall are all on the cards, with another round of severe storms due to hit south-east Queensland.

item.title: Nearly half of women enrolled in Queensland homebirth program transferred to hospital, report finds
item.description: The homebirth program was launched at the Sunshine Coast University Hospital in July 2024, with 74 women enrolled in the service in its first 12 months.

item.title: Federal government's homebuyer scheme helps young couple enter Brisbane property market as unit prices soar
item.description: A young couple bought a one-bedroom unit in inner-Brisbane using the government’s 5 per cent deposit scheme. Around the same time, a two-bedroom brick walk-up in the same suburb sold for just over $1m, highlighting soaring unit prices.

item.title: Thieves steal 65 young pigs from farm at Cranbrook in WA's Great Southern
item.description: A Cranbrook farmer says he feels like "the stuffing has been knocked out" of him after dozens of young pigs had been stolen from his property.

item.title: The Veronicas and Katy Perry songs behind Carlton and Hawthorn's finals campaigns
item.description: Before each game, the sides will blast a song to get their energy up, each emblematic of their seasons.

item.title: A Great Act of Love by Heather Rose delves into her family's convict history
item.description: In A Great Act of Love, the award-winning author interweaves a surprising chapter of Tasmanian history with the story of her ancestor who was transported to Van Diemen's Land in the 1800s.

item.title: Liz Stringer raises money for housing charities on huge tour
item.description: The renowned singer-songwriter is on the road in support of her eighth album. Now, more than ever, she knows how to focus on what matters.

item.title: Fuss-free sticky beef and noodles for busy weeknights - ABC News
item.description: This tasty, nourishing dish requires minimal prep and is quick and easy to throw together.

item.title: NT government flags new fines for owners whose pet crocodiles escape
item.description: Crocodile owners whose pets escape and have to be recaptured by rangers could soon face penalties starting at $300, plus another $100 for each hour the reptiles are on the loose.

item.title: Mona has lost $408 million since it opened in Tasmania but founder David Walsh doesn't mind
item.description: Hobart's landmark Museum of Old and New Art has racked up a staggering amount in losses since it opened in 2011, but founder David Walsh is still building.

item.title: Amyl and the Sniffers shout Melbourne live music venues $35k in free drinks after gig cancelled
item.description: After their homecoming Fed Square gig was cancelled over security fears, Amyl and the Sniffers put $5,000 behind the bar at seven live music venues around Melbourne.

item.title: Here's how Japan's PM found herself in a diplomatic spat with China over Taiwan
item.description: Sanae Takaichi has been in the top job for less than a month, but her comments detailing what Japan could do if China invaded Taiwan has sparked a diplomatic war.

item.title: Golf club in the scrub powered by a generator, community spirit and dirt-cheap fees
item.description: The only flashy thing at this golf club in regional Victoria is the community spirit, but it is enough for them to thrive.

item.title: Donald Trump signs order to drop tariffs on hundreds of foods, including beef
item.description: Hundreds of food products, including beef and oranges, are now exempted from US trade tariffs, according to an executive order signed by President Donald Trump on Friday.

item.title: Wallabies vow to bounce back in Ireland Test as spring tour continues in Dublin
item.description: Hit hard by last weekend's loss to Italy, the Wallabies are desperate to rebound when they face Ireland in Dublin on Sunday morning.

item.title: What Australia can learn from China to become the world's 'cleaner' rare earth refiner
item.description: As Australia races to scale up refining of rare earths, a thorny question looms: where does all the toxic wastewater go?

item.title: Karratha hopes to become NBL1 West's most remote basketball club
item.description: A community brimming with basketball enthusiasts in WA's north aims to join the NBL1 West within five years, becoming the most far-flung team to do so.

item.title: More than a month into the Israel-Gaza ceasefire, here is what has changed
item.description: The fragile ceasefire in Gaza has now been in place for five weeks. Here is what has changed, what has not, and where things currently stand.

item.title: Socceroos fall to disjointed 1-0 loss to Venezuela in Houston
item.description: Australia's hopes of a favourable draw for next year's World Cup take a hit with a disappointing 1-0 loss to Venezuela in Texas.

item.title: The 'gun' shearer still setting a cracking pace at 85
item.description: Australian shearing legend John Harris has returned to a central Victorian woolshed for the 75th year.

item.title: Queensland GPs to be able to diagnose adults with attention deficit hyperactivity disorder from December 1
item.description: From December 1, specialist general practitioners will have the ability to diagnose adults with ADHD and prescribe medication, in an Australian first.

item.title: Video games are not banned at this Japanese high school, they are part of the curriculum
item.description: Japan's education system is renowned for its rigidity. But one school is providing an alternative, blending typical education classes with intensive video game training.

item.title: NT's high rates of diabetes and amputations highlighted by territory health professionals on World Diabetes Day
item.description: The Northern Territory has some of the highest rates of diabetes globally, with health professionals warning that the cost of living is making it harder for those living in remote communities to access a nutritious diet.

item.title: US President Donald Trump says he plans to sue BBC for up to $US5 billion over documentary edit
item.description: The US president added that he also planned to raise the issue with British Prime Minister Keir Starmer.

item.title: First school reopens as risk from asbestos exposure deemed 'extremely low'
item.description: Seventeen schools were shut down on Friday after concerns about asbestos exposure. The reopening of one of the schools has been fast-tracked.

item.title: Cell Block Studios preserves history of Old Geraldton Gaol as a hub for local artists
item.description: Once a place of punishment, Old Geraldton Gaol is now a site of creativity after being saved from demolition by a group of local artists.

item.title: Urgent review of Federation Square security ordered after Amyl and the Sniffers concert cancelled
item.description: The operators of Federation Square promise an urgent security review after locked-out attendees broke through fences at the free concert, but say the band's fan base is not to blame.

item.title: Restaurant business booms as monsoon rains cause river to flood in Thailand
item.description: Fish are not just on the menu in this Thai restaurant — they are also swimming around the tables and bringing in diners happy to sit in waist-deep river water while enjoying their meals.

item.title: Coloured sand linked to asbestos contamination scare found at over 100 SA sites
item.description: Coloured sand products linked to an asbestos contamination scare have so far been identified at more than 100 sites in South Australia following checks at schools and preschools, the state's education department says.

item.title: Josh Hazlewood ruled out of Ashes opener in Perth in blow to Australia's hopes against England
item.description: Australian quick Josh Hazlewood is ruled out of the opening Ashes Test match against England in Perth with a hamstring injury.

item.title: Police to patrol Melbourne shopping centres in 90-day youth crime prevention trial
item.description: Victoria's police chief commissioner says groups of protective services officers and police officers will start patrolling shopping precincts before Christmas in an effort to reduce crime.

item.title: Hospitality group Norths Collective looking to offload Far North Coast clubs
item.description: Sydney-based Norths Collective looks to offload two Far North Coast sporting clubs to cap losses and pay down debt of about $30 million.

item.title: Melbourne comes back to beat Adelaide in AFLW semifinal, Carlton advances with Hawthorn demolition
item.description: Melbourne is through to the AFLW preliminary finals as Kate Hore inspires the Demons to a comeback win over Adelaide, while Carlton demolishes a depleted Hawthorn.

item.title: Three NT residents charged with fraud over alleged $71 million Defence contract scheme
item.description: The AFP has raided homes and businesses across Darwin after a tip-off that a Defence employee, his wife, and a director of a building firm were allegedly involved in a fraudulent scheme to steer multi-million-dollar Defence building contracts their way.

item.title: Astronaut Katherine Bennell-Pegg named SA's Australian of the Year
item.description: When Katherine Bennell-Pegg was growing up, she was "mesmerised by the stars" — an enthusiasm that motivated her to pursue astronaut training, and has now secured an honour of a different kind.

item.title: Explosion inside India-controlled Kashmir police station kills nine people, injures dozens
item.description: At least nine people are dead and dozens are injured after a cache of confiscated explosives detonates inside a police station in Indian-controlled Kashmir.

item.title: What France's famous cave replicas can teach Australia about rebuilding lost heritage
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Former Katter's Australian Party MP Nick Dametto ahead in early count for Townsville mayoral by-election
item.description: Eight candidates are vying for the top role, including the city's former mayor, Troy Thompson.

item.title: England completes sole Ashes warm-up match with flurry of runs to Ollie Pope, Joe Root
item.description: Ollie Pope tunes up for the first Ashes Test with hard-hitting knocks of 100 and 90 in England's only warm-up match at Lilac Hill.

item.title: Democratic Republic of Congo and M23 rebel group sign new roadmap to peace in Qatar
item.description: At the ceremony, Qatar's chief negotiator Mohammed Al-Khulaifi called the agreement "historic", adding that mediators would continue efforts to achieve peace on the ground.

item.title: Pope Leo XIV urges Hollywood actors to resist algorithms and save neighbourhood cinemas
item.description: Pope Leo XIV tells a group of leading Hollywood actors and filmmakers during an audience at the Vatican that more should be done to protect struggling neighbourhood cinemas, to preserve the shared experience of watching movies.

item.title: Social media has changed how we get the news and politicians are capitalising on it
item.description: When a delegation of "influencers" appeared at Canberra's budget lock-up this year, joining press gallery journalists in the increasingly arcane tradition of reading a complex document for a few quiet hours before bursting forth in analysis thereof, much comment was made.

item.title: The old-school landline is having a cultural moment in a world of screens
item.description: As smartphones swallow childhood, a growing movement of parents is reinstalling landlines, hoping an old-school corded phone can restore patience and connection.

item.title: Alex de Minaur exits ATP Finals as Jannik Sinner reaches decider
item.description: Alex de Minaur falls to Jannik Sinner for the 13th straight time, as the Italian advances to the final of the season-ending championship for the third consecutive year.

item.title: Survivors of Sudan's El-Fasher conquest say they were attacked while escaping
item.description: With Sudan's El-Fasher captured by a militia accused of mass killings, those who escaped are suffering in a refugee camp and mourning the deaths of family and friends.

item.title: Wallabies fall to record-breaking defeat against late-surging Ireland in Dublin, Mack Hansen scores hat-trick
item.description: The Wallabies's losing run on their spring tour continues, as Ireland records a convincing 46-19 victory on home soil.

item.title: Property investors say they're 'boosting rental supply', but it can be a rhetorical trick
item.description: Are they boosting the supply of rental housing by financing the construction of new dwellings, or buying pre-existing owner-occupied homes and converting them to rentals?

item.title: The infamous photo former prince Andrew can't outrun
item.description: More than 20 years after this photo was purportedly taken, it continues to haunt Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor.

item.title: England confident Jofra Archer will fire against Australia in Ashes
item.description: Injury may have stalled his Test career, but Jofra Archer is showing signs he will be at his best when the men's Ashes series gets underway in Perth on Friday.

item.title: Hard Quiz: We're here to test your trivia smarts. It's time to play … HARD!
item.description: It's the perfect day to confirm just how little you know.

item.title: Forestry looks to carbon market in wake of Great Koala National Park
item.description: The Great Koala National Park was announced to protect koalas and forests in northern NSW, but the forestry industry has been left wondering how it can fill a shortfall in supply.

item.title: John Aloisi reflects on the 20-year anniversary with ABC Weekend Breakfast.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: John Aloisi became an instant national hero after he helped send Australia through to the 2006 World Cup.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: The other-worldly ecstasy of the Socceroos' penalty shootout against Uruguay, 20 years on
item.description: Nostalgia can be an intoxicating force, especially when it comes to the 20-year anniversary of the Socceroos' remarkable win over Uruguay on penalties, which remains an Australian cultural touchpoint.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Rebuilding Juukan Gorge: Traditional owners turn to France for restoration plan
item.description: Five years after Rio Tinto destroyed a 47,000-year-old sacred rock shelter to expand an iron ore mine, an ambitious rebuild is underway drawing inspiration all the way from France.

item.title: Sunbury residents fear waste-to-energy proposal risks health and environment
item.description: Sunbury residents say they are tired of being the state's "dumping ground" after waste-to-energy facility proposed nearby a receives a cap license from Recycling Victoria.

item.title: Legal experts, civil libertarians warn the NSW government is 'eroding' the right to protest
item.description: When 60 neo-Nazis lined outside NSW parliament last week, the premier's response was swift and familiar — steadily tightening the state's protest laws in response to flashpoint events.

item.title: Deadly Indonesian landslide buries victims up to 8 metres deep in Java village
item.description: After days of heavy rain in Central Java, a landslide buries a dozen houses in Cibeunying village.

item.title: Endangered bandicoots given new home free of feral predators in regional NSW
item.description: Twenty endangered bandicoots are roaming south-west New South Wales in an effort to return bandicoots to the region after several species were wiped out in the late 1800s.

item.title: Sixers teenager Caoimhe Bray claims WBBL hat-trick in 24-run win over Thunder
item.description: Sydney Sixers rising star Caoimhe Bray needed to be told she had taken a hat-trick, as the 16-year-old added another WBBL highlight in a thumping derby defeat of the Thunder.

item.title: Gold Coast Schoolies celebrations set to be scaled back and subdued
item.description: Schoolies celebrations on the Gold Coast will look different this year due to beach erosion in the wake of Cyclone Alfred.

item.title: India and Pakistan have faced the deadliest terror attacks on their capitals in a decade
item.description: In just 48 hours, almost 30 people were killed and dozens more injured in the deadliest terrorist assaults on the capitals of both India and Pakistan in more than a decade.

item.title: NDIS funding uncertainty means Queensland couple 'may never be able to retire' as they care for their daughter
item.description: Darren and Louise Catton have spent years curating a care plan for their daughter Mary, but now face an uncertain future after her NDIS funding was cut dramatically.

item.title: Survival camping isn't for everyone — so how would you go in the wilderness? Take the quiz to find out
item.description: For 18-year-old Rivi, knowing what gear to leave behind can be as important as knowing what to take with.

item.title: Spectators injured when car crashes into crowd at Walcha showground rally
item.description: Nine people are hospitalised after a car crashed into spectators at a rally event in regional NSW on Saturday night.

item.title: Rain brings relief across much of Victoria but the drought is 'certainly not over'
item.description: Dusty Victorian farms turn muddy as drenching rain brings much-needed relief.

item.title: Rose Byrne plays a mother on the edge in Mary Bronstein's If I Had Legs I'd Kick You
item.description: The Sydney-born movie star discusses how her creative partnership with If I had Legs I'd Kick You director Mary Bronstein has opened the Oscars conversation.

item.title: Sergey Lavrov was one of Vladimir Putin's top allies on the world stage. And then, he was gone
item.description: For more than two decades, Sergey Lavrov has been Russia's top foreign diplomat, representing the Kremlin's regime around the world, but late last month, he disappeared.

item.title: Thunderstorms and heavy rain forecast for 'small pockets' of Queensland
item.description: The Bureau of Meteorology says parts of Queensland and New South Wales will likely see smaller pockets of severe thunderstorm activity on Sunday.

item.title: Inspection of Weona Park horse stud found several serious animal welfare issues, just weeks before public outcry
item.description: Investigators warned the "situation" at a horse stud in the state's south "is likely to [be] the next welfare issue hitting the news".

item.title: Storm Claudia floods town of Monmouth in Wales, after killing three people in Portugal
item.description: Storm Claudia moves to Wales, swamping the town of Monmouth, where dozens of people are rescued or evacuated from their homes.

item.title: Horned 'devil' bee found in remote Goldfields prompts call for further research
item.description: The discovery of a new "lucifer" bee with devil-like horns sparks concerns over land clearing regulations in WA's Goldfields region.

item.title: Amid ongoing drought in South Australia, these women are redefining resilience
item.description: Dusty paddocks, with no grain crop to harvest, and scarce feed for the few animals left, is the reality of many South Australian farmers right now. Four women are redefining resilience and showing what it means to endure tough conditions despite it all.
